Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Dr. Denis Mukwege never made the statement attributed to him in the meme. He confirmed this via Twitter.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or credible source provided to back up the assertion that Dr. Mukwege resigned because he was being offered money to falsify COVID-19 cases.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Dr. Mukwege's resignation from the coronavirus task force was due to being offered money to falsify cases, which is not supported by any factual evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation provided by Dr. Mukwege himself, stating that his resignation was driven by frustration over slow testing and subpar preventative measures.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by attributing a false statement to Dr. Mukwege, which he never made.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misattributing a statement to Dr. Mukwege, leading to the spread of misinformation.
